alert.note: Alert for Bennington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 5:04PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Berkshire, north central Columbia, southeastern Albany, northeastern Greene, Rensselaer and southwestern Bennington Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 504 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Nassau, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... East Greenbush, Nassau, Williamstown, Pownal, New Baltimore, Ravena, Stephentown, Coxsackie, Grafton, Berlin, Valatie, Castleton-On-Hudson, Kinderhook, West Sand Lake, Averill Park, Selkirk, Wynantskill, North Greenbush, Brunswick and Sand Lake. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between exits 10 and 9. Interstate 87 between exits 21B and 22. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for western Massachusetts...east central New York...and southern Vermont.
